title: Supercells of a single raster layer
text: first step read input data. , going use volcano.tif example data already included supercells package.  contains digital elevation model Maunga Whau volcano, value represents elevation sea level. supercells package can used delineate areas similar elevations. one main function, supercells(), expects least three arguments: x - input raster (object class SpatRaster terra package) k - expected number supercells compactness - compactness value. Larger values create compact/even (square) supercells supercells() output sf object, row represents single superpixel. stores supercell ids (supercells), coordinates supercell centers (x y), average input variables (elevation case). allows us plot supercells’ borders top input raster data:  vol_slic1 object can final result analysis used grouping clustering.
code: vol = rast(system.file("raster/volcano.tif", package = "supercells")) plot(vol) vol_slic1 = supercells(vol, k = 50, compactness = 1) vol_slic1 plot(vol) plot(st_geometry(vol_slic1), add = TRUE, lwd = 0.2)

title: Supercells of a single raster layer
text: supercells() function also set optional arguments, including: step - distance (number cells) initial superpixel’ centers. can used instead k dist_fun - distance function used calculate similarities raster values clean - connectivity supercell enforced? FALSE, supercells consist several nonadjacent regions. TRUE default. iter - number iterations performed create output. 10 default. Let’s try change values : output still structure (sf object supercell ids, coordinates centers, average input variables), slightly different number supercells, borders bit different.
code: vol_slic2 = supercells(vol, step = 11, compactness = 1, dist_fun = "euclidean",                         clean = FALSE, iter = 10) plot(vol) plot(st_geometry(vol_slic2), add = TRUE, lwd = 0.2)

title: Main changes since version 1.0.0
text: new version supercells package introduces consistent syntax across functions, set functions sc_ prefix. main function package sc_slic(), segments raster data supercells. replaces previous supercells() function (still available backward compatibility). function also two closely related functions alternative output formats: sc_slic_points() sc_slic_raster(). sc_slic() returns polygon supercells,sc_slic_points() returns centers points, sc_slic_raster() returns raster supercell IDs.    , sc_slic() main function, two functions useful specific tasks. example, sc_slic_points() helpful visualizing initial supercell centers iteration diagnostics, sc_slic_raster() useful large datasets polygon outputs may memory-intensive.
code: # Polygon supercells (sf) vol_sc <- sc_slic(   vol,   step = 8,   compactness = 1,   outcomes = c("supercells", "coordinates", "values") )  # Plot polygons on top of the volcano raster terra::plot(vol) plot(sf::st_geometry(vol_sc), add = TRUE, lwd = 0.6, border = "red") # Supercell centers as points (sf) vol_pts <- sc_slic_points(   vol,   step = 8,   compactness = 1 )  # Plot points on top of the volcano raster terra::plot(vol) plot(sf::st_geometry(vol_pts), add = TRUE, col = "red") # Supercell IDs as a raster (SpatRaster) vol_ids <- sc_slic_raster(   vol,   step = 8,   compactness = 1 )  # Plot raster IDs terra::plot(vol_ids)

title: Main changes since version 1.0.0
text: Use sc_tune_compactness() estimate compactness value short pilot run, run sc_slic() tuned value.  function also allow calculate compactness using second method called "local". sc_slic_points(..., iter_diagnostics = TRUE) attaches iteration diagnostics can visualize convergence mean distance across iterations later sc_plot_iter_diagnostics().
code: # Estimate compactness from a short pilot run comp_tune <- sc_tune_compactness(vol, step = 8) comp_tune #>   step metric compactness #> 1    8 global    6.864497  # Use the tuned value and plot results vol_sc_tuned <- sc_slic(vol, step = 8, compactness = comp_tune$compactness) terra::plot(vol) plot(sf::st_geometry(vol_sc_tuned), add = TRUE, lwd = 0.6, border = "red") # Iteration diagnostics plot (only available without chunking) vol_pts_diag <- sc_slic_points(   vol,   step = 8,   compactness = 1,   iter_diagnostics = TRUE ) sc_plot_iter_diagnostics(vol_pts_diag)

text: x object class SpatRaster (terra) class stars (stars) k number supercells desired user (output number can slightly different!). can use either k step. also possible provide set points (sf object) k together step value create custom cluster centers. compactness compactness value. Larger values cause supercells compact/even (square). Set compactness = "auto" enable adaptive compactness (SLIC0). compactness value depends range input cell values selected distance measure. dist_fun distance function. Currently implemented distance functions "euclidean", "jsd", "dtw" (dynamic time warping), name distance function philentropy package (see philentropy::getDistMethods(); "log2" used case), user defined function accepting two vectors returning one value. Default: "euclidean" avg_fun averaging function - values supercells' centers calculated? algorithm internally implements common functions "mean" "median" (provided quotation marks), also accepts fitting R function (e.g., base::mean() stats::median(), provided plain function name: mean). Default: "mean". See details information. clean connectivity supercells enforced? iter number iterations performed create output. transform Transformation performed input. default, transformation performed. Currently available transformation "to_LAB": first, conversion RGB LAB color space applied, supercells algorithm run, afterward, reverse transformation performed obtained results. (argument experimental may removed future). step distance (number cells) initial supercells' centers. can use either k step. minarea Specifies minimal size supercell (cells). works clean = TRUE. default, clean = TRUE, average area () calculated based total number cells divided number supercells Next, minimal size supercell equals /(2^2) (right shifted) metadata Logical. Controls whether metadata columns ("supercells", "x", "y") included. chunks input (x) processed chunking deriving supercells? Use FALSE (default), TRUE (automatic chunking based size), numeric value (chunk side length number cells). TRUE, memory limit can set options(supercells.chunk_mem_gb = 4). verbose integer specifying level text messages printed calculations. 0 means messages (default), 1 provides basic messages (e.g., calculation stage).
